intro: Lippia linearifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf lippia, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its slender, linear leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in open woodlands or along stream banks. It is known for its aromatic foliage and is sometimes used in traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its native habitat.
